message: I went ahead and bought an Eye-fi Connect X2 4gb card from ebay.  The eye-fi card allows you to automagically upload pictures to flickr, over wifi.  Now we just need an old/donated point-n-shoot digital camera.  I'm thinking 4gb+ and I think AA batteries would be ideal (so we can use rechargeable batteries.  I think the wifi will probably drain the camera batteries faster.)
Some info on using CF adapters with the eye-fi: http://forums.eye.fi/viewtopic.php?f=2&t=326

Psytek found/donated a dSLR that uses compact flash.  People have reported some success using CF-SD card adapters with the eye-fi.  We'll have to test it out.  If anyone has an adapter, please let me know.
Thats awesome!  I've been wanting one of those for the space for a while.  http://www.dealextreme.com/p/sdhc-sd-mmc-to-cf-type-ii-card-adapter-upto-32gb-22338 DealExtreme has one...
thanks for picking one up, I can't wait to use it
Before we order the CF adapter, let's test that DSLR, and do we need a lens?
cool, yes we need a lens,

Tim says he has a camera, but has not brought it in yet.  RadioShack has a good deal on the Canon Powershot SD1300.  http://dealnews.com/Canon-Power-Shot-SD1300-IS-12-MP-Digital-Camera-for-70-in-store/468447.html  Maybe donate your old, busted digicam and upgrade to this new unit?  I have the SD1200 and I am very happy with it.
Do we think that a DIY light box/tent would be useful to have at the space?  Example: http://jpgmag.com/stories/458
Yes.  Is the camera around?  I can order the SD to CF adapter from DealExtreme.
The DSLR still needs to be tested with a lens to see if it works, no?

Eric tested the DSLR, it is a Canon EOS 5D (Mark I).  It accepts Canon EF lenses, but not EF-S lenses.  To get this camera operational we need a lens and a CF-SD adapter.  I'm still interested in a simple point-and-shoot if anyone has one to donate to the space.  It is unclear when we will get a lens to fit this DSLR.
@matthewfoglia said he has some lenses, maybe he can help

There is some info that the X2 series of Eye-fi cards do not work in the CF adapters.  The card I purchased is X2, which is the current generation of eye-fi cards.  http://forums.eye.fi/viewtopic.php?f=2&t=2105  (If we buy an adapter, maybe buy it from amazon, which has a good return policy.)
Users report increased WiFi range on adapters that you can remove the metal shielding: http://blog.pocketphojo.com/2009/07/04/eye-fi-compactflash-adapters/
